meanings.definition: A distinct group within a larger population.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the subpopulation of red squirrels is smaller than the gray squirrels.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the subpopulation of elderly patients to understand their healthcare needs.
meanings.sent3: The subpopulation of picky eaters at the party only wanted to eat pizza.
meanings.sent4: The subpopulation of book lovers in the library was like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The subpopulation of marathon runners in the city was a vibrant and energetic community.

meanings.definition: A subset of individuals within a population.
meanings.sent1: The subpopulation of students who preferred math over art was small.
meanings.sent2: The conservationists focused on protecting the subpopulation of endangered sea turtles.
meanings.sent3: The subpopulation of movie buffs in the cinema cheered loudly during the film.
meanings.sent4: The subpopulation of early risers in the neighborhood greeted each other with smiles every morning.
meanings.sent5: The subpopulation of bird watchers in the park carried binoculars and bird guides.
